answers.answer: Hello,Phentermine can alter your blood sugar levels, if you are going to try using it please use it with caution and monitor your blood sugar levels more frequently... if you notice changes and if your blood sugars are becoming too low then stop taking phentermine, and seek further advice about what you could use instead of phentermine. Remember that diabetes should be your priority.Regards, Dee,
You should discuss with your local Pharmacist, the expert on drugs. Consultation is usually free of charge. Take a list of ALL medications, supplements and vitamins with you.

question: I want to know if it will do harm to take both menications can i take januvia for diabetic and phentermine at the same time or will i get a reaction to the medication
title: mixing medication
